results.name: wordpress-deployment/mysql

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/mysql-8bc6764c9-zfjj4], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service can't find any ready endpoints because the pod isn't ready.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod logs using `kubectl logs Pod/mysql-8bc6764c9-zfjj4`.
3. Verify readiness probe configuration.
4. Ensure pod dependencies are available.

results.name: wordpress-deployment/wordpress

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-58cc6dd7b7-pglk7 Pod/wordpress-58cc6dd7b7-8lf95 Pod/wordpress-58cc6dd7b7-lkz29], expected 3

results.details:
Error: The service is missing ready endpoints because the expected 3 pods are not ready.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod logs using `kubectl logs [pod-name]`.
3. Verify readiness probes in pod specs.
4. Ensure pods have necessary resources and network access.

results.name: wordpress-deployment/mysql-8bc6764c9-zfjj4

error.Text: Liveness probe failed: dial tcp 10.244.2.6:3306: connect: connection refused

results.details:
Error: The Kubernetes liveness probe failed because it couldn't connect to the service at IP 10.244.2.6 on port 3306.

Solution: 
1. Check if the service is running on the correct IP and port.
2. Verify network policies or firewall rules.
3. Ensure the application is listening on the specified port.
4. Review service and pod configurations.

results.name: wordpress-deployment/wordpress-58cc6dd7b7-8lf95

error.Text: Readiness probe failed: HTTP probe failed with statuscode: 500

results.details:
Error: The readiness probe failed because the application returned a 500 status code, indicating an internal server error.

Solution: 
1. Check application logs for errors.
2. Ensure all dependencies are running.
3. Verify configuration settings.
4. Restart the application.
